We may note the following general principles os Plautine prosody.

A. Shortening of long syllables.

The most noteworthy cases are those in which words which we should naturally scari as iambi ( v - ) become pyrrhic ( ν ν ). When the accent or emphasis os pronunciation falls upon the short first syllable, the second syllable instead os being long is reckoned as short, probably because in popular pronunciation the long unemphasised syllable was found heavy and incon- venient. Thus we get dorm, bonis, sons—3 number os im- peratives tene, abl, vide, Sec.
